summary: The Wii is a video game console made by Nintendo, released in 2006. It's Nintendo's fifth big console, competing with Microsoft's Xbox 360 and Sony's PlayStation 3. The Wii's unique feature is its motion-sensing controller, the Wii Remote, which lets you control games with gestures. The Wii was cheaper to make than its rivals and became very popular, selling over 101 million units. It was the best-selling console of its generation and made Nintendo a big player in the market again. The Wii was eventually replaced by the Wii U in 2012.
title: Wii
